inn1.comm: length ball on the pads from over the wicket, Tharanga looks to turn it to the leg side and gets it to midwicket
Hambantota has seen its first runs, as Tharanga opens the face and steers a slow back of length delivery that angles across him harmlessly
leaves the third ball alone as it holds its line and angles across again
not more than a trundle really, from Chohan, but good lines so far. Back of a length around off stump, Tharanga reaches out and defends to the off side
on middle and leg this time, again nothing to drive, Tharanga works it off the pads to the leg side
loud appeal for lbw as Chohan raps Tharanga on the pads with a back of length ball. Seemed to land just outside leg as Tharanga looked to work it to the on side. No referral made.
hits the deck back of a length and gets it to hit the bat hard as Tharanga defends from the crease
a short ball now, nice carry but it didn't exactly zip off the surface. Tharanga was comfortably into the pull shot and got it square for a couple

back of a length outside Dilshan's off stump this time and he plays that force-cut shot that he's made his own. Incredible how he manages to time that despite the lack of room. This time he finds point

Dilshan's away with a boundary, again that patent scythe through point. Short again, not very wide, Dilshan almost played the pull, starting the arc around third man and ending at mid off, and the ball sped to the left of a diving point. Crisp shot
short again, but this time even Dilshan could not make room as he looked to force it away
uh-oh, free-hit coming up. Decent ball otherwise, not there for the drive outside off as Dilshan tries to punch through the off side
bowls the bouncer, Dilshan saw it and was onto it in a flash. Osinde, however, had protection at deep backward square leg and Dilshan's pull raced away straight to the fielder

alright folks, this could be fun. Dilshan has tried to hit every single ball so far. Chohan obliges with a gentle half volley just outside off. Dilshan liked it so much he did not bother with footwork and just thumped it through extra cover. Violence.
and again, just a little fuller and making it tougher for Dilshan to drive, he still timed it well and straight to cover
Chohan shortens the length, Dilshan stays in the crease and plays his first defensive shot of the day, to the man who has just moved to short cover
another full and flowing over-pitched offering outside off, Dilshan whacks the leather off it with a smeared cover drive and Davison does well at cover to field it
back of good length this time, Dilshan check drives straight to cover
good finish to the over, Chohan again keeps it wisely short of a length and it is defended to short cover
Osinde drifts onto Tharanga's pads and he doesn't make connection with the flick. Leg bye through square leg,
huge wide, so wide that the irrepressible Dilshan can't reach it, though he tries to bend towards the off side and dangle the bat at it.
short of a length a foot outside off, Dilshan goes for the cut and expends a lot of energy with his vicious bat swing, but doesn't time it
again short of length outside off, Dilshan is swinging so wildly outside off, he might do a muscle or something. Another swish and a miss.
ah you expect better from Canada. Poor fielding at point as Dilshan forces a short ball off the back foot. Surkari the culprit, and they have a single
full length on off stump, Tharanga moves into the check drive and plays it smoothly into the covers
the first sign of swing, but it is wasted down the leg side

beats him outside the off, good ball from Osinde as he gets one to hold its line, having got the previous ball to move inwards. Tharanga gets half forward and plays for the movement and ends up playing inside the line.

ah, Dilshan was getting desperate waiting for the sightscreen to be sorted out, he's rifled the first ball on resumption emphatically through the covers. Length ball, sits up nicely for Dilshan who bends low and comes up with fury and thumps it hard.
again full, but not so wide. No matter, Dilshan still timed the square drive on the up, but found the fielder in the deep
angled across Tharanga back of a length, he stays back and cuts behind square
good delivery, on a length around off and extra bounce, it catches Tharanga by surprise as he defends off the front foot

whoa, Tharanga's played that rather imperiously. Back of a length and angling across, but now much width, he just moves his front foot out of the way and carves it through the covers. Good fielding in the deep, keeps it down to three. That shot was special since he improvised with the feet, but did not butcher it. Just clean connection and through the gap.
that foot of width outside off again for Dilshan, he hits it hard and straight to point

Surkari has redeemed himself with an awesome stop at point. Short and wide, asking to be hit and Tharanga guides it smartly, and it seemed headed for four to the left of point. Someone forgot to inform Surkari who flew away and stopped it with one hand.
begins with a nice inviting nothing length ball outside off and Tharanga drives it through the covers for a couple
again some width outside off, Tharanga drives on the up but it is intercepted at cover
that one kept low outside off as Tharanga shaped to cut and he ended up getting an outside edge, on the bounce to the keeper
length ball on off stump, Tharanga stays on the crease and defends with the full face
closer to the batsman this time and angling across, Tharanga opens the wrists and guides to short cover
tight stuff from Chohan, on a length and it goes through at a low height for Dilshan to play a checked cover drive
just back of a length and enough room outside off for Dilshan to play the steer. Point jumps away and cuts it off once again

this is actually very good disciplined bowling. Chohan has no pace, but he's not giving any freebies. Back of a length, on off stump, and even a restless Dilshan can't muscle it through the covers. He pats it into the off side for a single
again, Chohan keeps it tight and slow, Tharanga defends from the line of middle and off.
marginal width for Tharanga, he looks to clear the front foot away and carve over the off side, but finds the fielder

Tharanga breaks free with a smartly executed off drive. Chohan lands this closer to the batsman, Tharanga is relieved by the length as he plonks the front foot forward and drives through the line, in the air, but to the left of mid off.
a Collingwoodesque trundle, offcutter landed just outside off, Dilshan can't do much with it
Baidwan is slower than Chohan, and he gives Dilshan a sliver of width outside off, Dilshan gives it everything as he looks to play the extravagant cut and gets an outside edge to third man
better line and length, Dilshan can't drive or cut, he just defends
again, tight line back of a length outside off and Dilshan defends with an angled bat to the off side
looks to steer him square again, but finds point

another dot ball, good recovery. Back of a length and very close to off stump - the sort of ball you perfect in gully cricket. Dilshan tries to pack a punch in his cut, but hits it feebly in the direction of point
full length ball, Tharanga looks for the off drive again, but plays it off the inside half back to the bowler
slower ball from the slow Chohan, Tharanga waits and waits and dabs it to third man for one
length ball to Dilshan, he sets himself up for that booming cover drive again, but it is just not coming on to the bat. Gets only a single to deep cover

nifty stuff from Bagai and a stumping appeal that's refered to the 3rd umpire. Tharanga looked to get the front foot forward and play into thre off side, but it slipped past the outside edge. Bagai, standing up, collects and whips the bails off in a trice. Tharanga's foot had slipped out, but he dragged it back. Just in time.

good fielding by Gordon running back from mid on. This is a monster long boundary! Full from Chohan, on middle and leg, Tharanga gets under it and drives powerfull down the ground past mid on. He recovers from the dive and tags it all the way to keep it down to three
back of a length outside off, punched firmly to the covers
short ball, angles across slowly. Tharanga has sized up the pitch and conditions, he decides to rely on deflections. Single steered to third man

Dilshan's dumped him back down the ground. Dearly disdainful Dilshan. Friendly length ball at something around 120 kph, Dilshan happily reaches out gets under it and thumps it back with a straight bat.

the only thing worse than a length ball at this pace, is a full toss at this pace. Baidwan finds out the hard way. Dilshan didn't even break into a sweat this time, just waited for it and punched it back between the pitch and mid on
width this time, that's the entire gamut of what not to bowl. Dilshan cracks it away square for a couple
fuller length ball coming in and Dilshan heaves it away edgily through square leg for one
Tharanga tries to play the square drive, but finds the fielder at point, to end the over with a dot ball
lands this outside off and Dilshan looks for the cover drive. Can't find the gap though
very full and on the stumps, Dilshan is quick to play the sweep, but it was onto him faster than he expected
not this time. Hansra fires it in on middle and leg, Dilshan is ready in a flash and sweeps powerfully for four
full length again, not an iota of turn yet, Dilshan drives off the front foot into the off side
this time he opens the face and gets it to elude the man at cover. Single to the deep
on Dilshan's pads and he looks for the heave over the on side. Gets a single to backward square leg
back of a length to Tharanga outside the off stump and he stays on the crease to punch firmly into the covers
full length on the stumps and defended to the of side
slower ball slips down the leg side as Dilshan looks to sweep and it is called a wide
length ball angling in, lands on middle as Dilshan looks to force through the on side. Gets just the single

For the second time in two days, the first wicket is thanks to a horrible mix-up and Tharanga is gone. Back of a length outside off, and Tharanga guides it wide of mid off and sets off for a single. He is three-fourths of the way down the track when he notices that Dilshan is actually turning the other way. Tharanga almost completed one and a half runs, but fell short by a foot though he dived in.

whoa, what happened there? Baidwan got it to nip in a touch off the seam, from the line of off stump and it popped up, possibly off the inside half of Sanga's bat, onto the pad and to the leg side. Hmm.
tossed up on the pads, flicked with the spin through midwicket
this one stops a touch and turns away from Sanga as he stays back and plays to the on side
Sanga's away with a single, drives off the leg stump line to mid on
dead bat from Dilshan. Shock and horror. Full on off stump and defended to the off side
plays with the turn down the ground, but can't get it past mid on
too full, too wide and too easy for Sanga who opens the face and steers off the front foot to third man
Dilshan rolls along to 5000 ODI runs. Baidwan helps him along with a short ball outside off, Dilshan resists the temptation to jump around in glee. Waits for it and cracks it through the off side.
better line, no width this time as Dilshan tries to force off the back foot
slower ball, full on off stump and Dilshan decides to defend as it comes on slowly
full toss on the pads, Dilshan swipes it off the pads through square leg for one
Sanga stays on the crease and dinks the last ball with an angled face towards point
straightens from off stump, Dilshan reaches out and defends to the off side with soft hands. Single
Sanga skips out, he sees him and holds it back. Sanga is forced to adjust and defend. Well bowled by Hansra
again Sanga goes downtown Hambantota and returns without finding a deal as Hansra holds it back
stays in the crease this time and steers with the spin towards cover point
full on off stump, Sanga leans out and check drives with the spin to cover
Dilshan stays in the crease and opens the face to dab towards third man. He can't beat the man inside the circle
back of a length on off stump, Sanga reaches out and defends
a sliver of width outside off and Sanga dabs it backward of square for a single
short of a length outside off, Dilshan cuts powerfully into the deep for another single
on Sanga's pads as it angles in and he plays it off the angle to the on side
over-pitched outside off as Sanga looks to cover drive, but he misses out
this time Sanga knifes the cover drive through the gap and gets three runs.
Hansra starts the over with a length ball outside off, punched back to the bowler

leans across and punches that towards cover, well timed  by Sangakkara, a long chase for the fielder, who cuts it off just within the rope, another three, we might see a lot of those on this big ground
a quicker ball outside off, Dilshan goes for a flamboyant cut but misses
tucked towards midwicket for a sharp single
fullish ball outside off, eased towards mid-off by Sangakkara, who specialises in picking off the singles and twos in the middle overs
on the pads, swept firmly, but can't beat short fine leg
worked behind square leg for an easy single
looks to cut a delivery that is very close to offstump, bottom-edges it and that nearly cannons on to the stumps, bounces over
rolls his fingers to deliver a slower ball, pushed towards cover
another slower ball, Sangakkara has to check his drive, shouts of 'Catch it' but it lands short of backward point

dropped, a great effort by Nitish Kumar at backward point, dives across to his left after Sangakkara cracks one in his direction, gets his hands on it but can't latch on, the youngest player in the World Cup would have pulled off a stunner if that stuck
punched back towards the bowler by Sangakkara
on the pads this time, Sangakkara paddle-sweeps this one
pushed towards the bowler once more, tight over so far
more defending back to the bowler, Hansra getting through his over quickly
gets on the back foot and drives firmly towards cover
short ball on legstump, tucked towards square leg fir a single that brings up his half-century

That's the end of Dilshan, holes out to deep cover, a short of length ball well outside off,  Dilshan chases after that one and gets it only as far as the fielder in the deep, Dilshan falls for exactly 50
on the pads, tucked behind square leg
shortish ball outside off, delicately steered towards third man for a single
pushed towards mid-on off the front foot, thinks of a single but decides against it
back of a length outside off, jabbed towards cover
short ball and wide outside off, chopped between the covers, not particularly well timed though so it doesn't make it to the boundary
overpitched on the pads, pushed to long-on for one more
clipped towards midwicket this time, Sangakkara can't find the gap
ambled singles are going to be the preferred scoring style for the next few overs, Sanga gets it towards long-on this time
Jayawardene works the ball towards deep midwicket
Sanga keeps the singles coming, to long-on this time, a slow pitch with little movement, Canada will have a hard time getting these two out
pushed towards extra cover, another single, not ambled this time, they put the skates on, they needn't have worried, the throw is wild
way outside off, but just within legal limits, Mahela leaves it to the keeper
poked towards backward point by Mahela, can't beat the fielder
cute from Mahela, well outside off, there was a slip in place, still Mahela opens the face and jabs that towards third man for a quick two
ungainly but effective from Mahela, he usually oozes elegance, not this time, gets on one knee and slog sweeps powerfully from outside off to the square leg boundary
back of a length ball outside off, pushed back to the bowler
poked towards backward point to end the over

Referral time, Canada are convinced Mahela edged that ball to the keeper, umpire doesn't, tossed up by Hansra, bouncing on a length outside off, Mahela looks to guide that towards short third, the ball nestles in the keeper's gloves, Canada were absolutely certain, and immediately asked for the referral, very hard to tell given that there was no Snicko, or Hot Spot, Mahela survives
Mahela isn't going to stop trying to score runs towards third man, opens the face to guide the ball, Sanga calls early for the single
no risks at all for Sanga, an overpitched on the pads, driven all along the ground for a single
gets a big stride in as he defends to the leg side
looks to muscle the ball through the off side, totally mistimed, the ball rolls back towards the bowler
whipped towards the leg side for a single to end the over
starts with a short of length ball, turns a bit away, defended

Canada's fielding has been pretty good so far today, this time it wasn't, sanga tipped the ball towards square leg and set off for a single, the fielder at square leg can't collect the ball cleanly and gives away an extra run
defended to the leg side
the googly from Rao, spins away after pitching well outside off, chopped towards point
blocked towards the bowler off the front foot
gets on the back foot and tucks the ball from middle stump behind square leg for a single
first six of the match, Mahela launches that one into orbit, there was a long-on in place but Mahela wasn't bothered by that, he waltzes down the track and clubs that beyond the rope
tucks this one towards midwicket for a single
down the leg side, Sangakkara looks to swipe that one but misses, so does the keeper

another referral, again it is for Mahela being caught behind, the keeper Bagai is absolutely confident, it was overpitched and outside off, Mahela looks to drive that through the off, ball goes through to the keeper, Bagai called for the referral immediately though one had been turned down recently, Mahela survives again, that's the fifth referral that has backed the umpire's decision, with no supporting tools for the third umpire, not sure how the decision can be overturned
plays it late and guides it towards short third man
last ball of the over is driven to long-off for a single
an open face presented by Mahela, ball flies towards backward point, gets a single
full ball on the pads, driven towards wide mid-on for a single
a bit of width, Mahela looks to steer that past backward point, can't beat the fielder
another dot ball as Mahela pushes the ball towards point
was that the googly? looked like it, inside-edged towards backward square leg
plenty of confused calling after Sanga jabs the ball behind point, fielder is quickly on to the ball, no run
this was not a powerful hit from Mahela, more about placement, gets on one knee and sweeps that one in the air towards deep midwicket, doesn't carry all the way bit well wide of the fielder
outside off, Mahela carves that behind backward point, in the air for a bit, sliding stop  from the man at deep backward point
Sanga continues to play it safe, punches it to long-off for an ambled single
fullish ball outside off, pushed towards cover off the front foot
length ball on off, it's Mahela's turn to play it down the ground for a single
overpitched delivery, dismissed by Sangakkara, this is an expensive over for Canada, Sangakkara just whipped that over wide mid-on for a boundary, all too easy
strays down the leg side, Mahela gets some bat on it as he looks to sweep,  ball races away towards fine leg
poor delivery this, short ball and outside leg, lucky that wasn't send to the boundary, Mahela powers it towards deep square leg
responds with a good turn, slightly quicker, and turns in, Sangakkara is beaten as he looks to drive
big appeal for lbw, a flighted delivery from Balaji, pitching outside leg and hits Sanga on the pads outside leg as well as he looks to sweep
don't bowl down the leg side when fine leg is in the circle, Balaji Rao sends it short and outside leg, Mahela helps it past short fine, four more and Sri Lanka are turning it on now
pushed towards cover for a single to end the over
another single to Mahela, makes a bit of room and works the ball towards backward point
driven towards extra cover, can't beat the man there
length ball on off, this time Sanga gets his favourite single to long-off, pushes it along the ground, he can do this all day
outside off, dabbed towards third man by Mahela
this time it's sanga who goes down on one knee to swipe the ball towards cow corner, four more to Sri Lanka
way outside off, Sanga gets on the back foot and jabs the ball towards cover to get a single
starts with a wide delivery down the leg side, Sanga unhappy he could sweep that for four
closer to legstump this time, Sanga tucks it fine down the leg side for a single
more safety-first cricket, no trouble at all for Mahela as he pushes the ball towards cover
bit of bounce for Johnson, he beats Mahela outside off
Mahela brings out the reverse-sweep, he plays this shot very well, connects powerfully and that beats short third for a boundary, Mahela tumbles over as he plays that
a fine half-century for Mahela, gets there by showing he can play the conventional sweep very well too, places it past short fine for four more
shortish and outside off, Mahela stabs that towards cover point where a diving stop prevent more runs
Shot! brilliant from Sangakkara, well outside off, but Sanga comes down the track and lofts that straight back down the ground, clears the long boundary
pushed back towards the bowler
on the pads, Sanga glances it towards short fine leg
flighted delivery, lands on a length on middle and leg, punched down to long-off for a single, that was a googly from Balaji
gives plenty of air, nice to see from the spinner, but he's going for plenty of runs since the line is wrong, on the pads , Mahela gets on one knee and sweeps powerfully to square leg
guided towards backward point by Mahela

on Sanga's pads and he flicks straight to square leg. Hang on, we have a third umpire referral as the stumps are broken as Mahela makes his ground. A direct hit would have had him, but he had a vital extra second before Bagai could gather and whip the bails off.
tossed up and turning into the pads, Mahela gently works it through midwicket for one
Sanga chips out, Davison holds it back and beats him in the flight. Sanga adjusts and defends
turn again from off stump, Sanga feels for it as he guides it square for one
fuller on off stump, Mahela reaches out and works it with the spin through midwicket
Sanga works against the spin and nurdles a single through square on the leg side. They are building up nicely for the end overs
length ball on off stump, Mahela moves forward and drives with the full face for a single to long on
on a length and on middle stump, Sanga stands back and drives down the track with a full face
this comes on slowly to Sanga's pads, and he works it behind square for a single. His 49th run
another length ball, on off stump, Mahela leans out and drives through extra cover
Sanga reaches 50 with a pull shot, he's slowly moved into form here. Short ball, he was always hanging back in expectation and when it came he creamed it over the infield

dropped by Balaji. Another short ball, but this came on very slowly and was in line with off stump, Sanga did not time it and hit it uppishly. It landed just in front of the portly leggie as he dived forward, and he could not pouch it.

Mahela is unstoppable now. Dainty little dab through third man for two as Davison turns one in from wide of off stump. Mahela hangs back, waits for it to reach Bagai's gloves, almost, before opening the wrists and coaxing it away.
straighter this time, Mahela moves inside the line and turns it square for one more

third umpire asked for and Sangakkara might be in trouble. Or not. Davison was confident as the throw came in from cover-point. But Sanga made his ground by half a foot. He reached out and steered it square, and always had the single under control
Mahela looks for another flick to midwicket, but can't find the gap this time
this time Davison slips it down the leg side and it is called a wide
Mahela steps across and works across the pads through wide mid on for single
ends with one on Sanga's pads and he pushes it square with soft hands. Still, can only pick a single
back of a length on leg stump, clipped squarew but straight to the fielder

no Chohan, you can't over-pitch on Sanga's pads, even if he isn't in form. Because then, he will dump you relentlessly through square leg, just like that. It don't matter how many you have in the deep, he will find a gap.
full again, but on middle and off, Sanga pushes through mid off for a single
that came on slower than Mahela expected and he ended up dragging the off drive through mid on for a single
generous Chohan gives Sanga another gift, again on the pads, and this time short. Sanga waits for it to sit up and then slaps it away through backward square leg
and now he over-pitches on off, and in most grounds, that would have been four as Sanga leant out and drove through the line elegantly. It slows up in the huge outfield and he's restricted to two
extra turn from off and middle, but Mahela has no issues with it as he gets the front foot across and works it square
Sanga skips out and deliberately over wide mid on for a couple. He's in that zone now, and he will toy with this attack all the way to the end.
flatter and quicker, forces Sanga back and he works it through midwicket for one
on Mahela's pads, he will nudge those singles through the leg side all day if he has to
flighted on middle and Sanga advances to reach the pitch and on-drive for a single
short ball, Mahela latches on in a flash and rolls the wrists over a controlled pull. There is protection in the deep so he is restricted to a single

that's a Mahela special. Saw him do this several times in the IPL. Full ball angling into him, Mahela responds by moving the front foot across outside off and then laps it along with the angle, fine enough to beat the man at 45 on the leg side inside the circle. That wasn't too far away from being a six
almost in the blockhole, Mahela digs it out to the leg side of the pitch

oho, a thing of beauty that shot! Full toss from Chohan on the pads, most batsmen would have brutalised it, but not for Mahela the violent shots. He waves his magic wand in a short reluctant arc and redirects the ball in front of square leg for four
he down shifts a gear now to pick up a single through mid on
ho ho hoick from Sanga. Over-pitched on leg stump, Sanga swings smoothly, high over midwicket and into the boundary. This bowling is meat, drink and dessert. Unlimited. On the house. And calorie-free
fuller and better line, on off stump and Sanga gets a single with an off drive
offie outside off, Sanga waits and taps towards point for one
flighted on off, Mahela gets inside the line and works it through midwicket for one more
Sanga again chips over the infield, and short of the men in deep, intentionally. Tossed up, he skips out and dinks it straight over mid off for a couple
another single as Mahela's wrists come into play a turn a delivery turning in from off towards midwicket
back of a length on off stump from round the wicket and Sanga punches it back to the leg side of the pitch for a single
short and wide outside off, Mahela focuses on placement rather than power as he deflects it into the gap through point for a couple
tossed up on the stumps, Sanga works with the spin to the leg side and the bowler fields
drops the googly short, Sanga hangs back, picks it early and cuts through covers for a couple
over-pitched on middle and leg, Sanga gets the front foot across to sweep for the 150th run of the stand. It's come off 116 balls.
Mahela is finding gaps everywhere and plugging them with the dexterity of a dentist. Reaches across and works him against the spin through midwicket for a couple
drives with the spin, but straight to cover
on the pads as Mahela shapes to sweep. He gets something on it, behind square, for a single
Mahela chips Davison with the spin over mid on but short of long on for a single
Sanga does it now, lofting him without the intention of clearing the fielders in the deep. Another single down the ground
three on the trot, this is more golf than cricket. Mahela tees off for a single down the ground now
Sanga looks to sweep and misses out
Davison keeps it flat and straight, Sanga punches on the up through wide mid on for another single
over-pitched on the pads, Mahela gladly uses the extra pace and sweeps it towards deep backward square leg for a single
on middle and leg, Mahela looks for the lap sweep, did that hit bat or pad first? Polite appeal turned down, as they take a couple
looks for another run through square leg, but finds the fielder this time
drops this short outside off, Mahela hangs back and cuts straight to the fielder
he'll do this all day, and now that lights are on, he'll do this all night. On the pads, Mahela easily clips it square and runs for the 250th run

inventive from Sanga and he gets four for his efforts. Rank short wrong 'un that turns away and sits up for Sanga to bang through the off side. He concentrated on getting it over the head of the cover fielder and picked up four
driven to long on for a couple more. Ominous signs.

and now bad fielding in the deep. This is not the easiest outfield to manage, and Sri Lankak born Ruvindu Gunasekara doesn't do it too well. Tossed up and turning in, Mahela goes down on a knee and slog sweeps. Ruvindu rubs back and looks to cover the angle, but lets it through as he tumbles.
again Mahela goes leg sidish as it turns in from outside off. Over to Sanga
and now an outside edge that doesn't go to hand. Davison gets some extra turn and beats Sanga's flashing drive, the edge flies very fine and slows up in the outfield
and now he drops short, too many bad balls. Mahela waits and cuts dextrously into the gap at deep point for a couple
works it off the pads this time for a single to wide mid on

Sangakkara has not made a 100 since the 2008 Asia Cup. The wait continues. He pops a gentle return catch as Davison slows it up and gets it to turn a bit. Sanga did not get entirely forward, he was possibly trying to chip it in the air as he's done all day. He did, but could not clear the bowler. He knows he has missed an easy 100 today. It went off the bottom of the bat, he possibly should have come more forward to drive.
Mahela hangs back and works with the angle through square leg for one more.
short googly, skids on as Thisara picks it, hangs back and cuts in front of square for one
flat delivery on leg stump, Mahela stays back and taps to square leg.
nice googly flighted on leg stump, Thisara gets a leading edge as he looks to flick and gets a single to cover
leans out and works another single through square leg for one more.
full on leg stump, Thisara moves to the leg side, takes it on the pitch and flicks powerfully for a single
Thisara nearly spoons a catch to short cover. Tossed up on off, he reaches out and drives without getting to the pitch. Almost straight to the fielder
holds it back again, Thisara plays down the ground back to the bowler
Thisara turns it over, smears a full ball through mid on for a single. Mahela on 99...
Mahela breaks the record, well played. He leans out and works it with the spin through midwicket - typifies his entire innings, this shot.
Perera gets another single down the ground

Well, Mahela was tiring, it did seem he was going to throw caution to the winds once he reached 100. He gets across the line and looks to lap sweep over short fine leg. Makes good connection, but can't get it over the fielder. Ends up giving the fielder catching practice. Well played, Mahela.
short of a length on leg stump, Thisara stays back and works it through midwicket for one
fuller length on off stump, driven on the up towards long off for one more
keeps it fuller this time, Thisara looks for a vicious whip to the leg side, but misses
this ons'e sliding down the leg as Thisara clips it behind square for a single
very straight and on a length, Angelo quietly nudges through midwicket for a single

there you go, Thisara has given a trailer of what he can do. Baidwan assists him with a juicy length ball on leg stump, Thisara sets up a stable base and swings with glee through backward square leg for four

Thisara may be run out here. Full ball on off stump, Mathews digs it out straight to point and takes off. The throw was perfect, beside the stumps and left Bagai with little to do. Thisara was close to a foot out of his ground when the stumps were broken. Crucial wicket, I'd say.
full toss on the pads and Kapu works it to midwicket for a single

Mathews kicks off in good style, gets an over-pitched ball just outside off as he backs away and opens up the off side. The bat comes down in a decisive rapier swing and sends the ball scooting through backward point.
offcutter comes in from outside off and Mathews nudges it with the deviation for a single
Kapu gets anlother single, full delivery on the pads, hit powerfully but straight to midwicket

cheeky from Angelo. He does what Mahela was trying to do, and gets it right. He moves the front foot across to outside off stump and then laps it up with a flourish, with the angle, over short fine leg's head

Kapu has perished. Seemed to not pick the change in pace as Baidwan delivered a full slow delivery on off stump. Kapu turned the face early as he looked to work it square, but the ball came through in the next era. He got a leading edge and it ballooned up for an easy take at cover
bouncer, whizzes past Mathews as he ducks. It came off the track slowly, but he chose to let it go

well played Mathews, hangs around the line of leg stump to ensure he had room to swing through the off side. Good thing he did, since Baidwan did not offer much room. Mathews waited for the short ball to sit up and them whacked it through covers
offcutter, doesn't bounce much as Mathews works it to the leg side for Sri Lanka's 300th and 301st runs.
full toss on Mathews pads, he squeezes it out through square leg for a couple more. Words exchanged between Baidwan and Angelo, they seemed to be in each other's way as Angelo ran.
things are bristling over here, Baidwan bangs it in too short and it is called wide. Bagai and umpire Gould are in discussion. All's not well!
slower ball comes onto the pads and Angelo gets some pad on it as he looks to flick it square.
another offcutter, the ball is gripping on the track. I await Murali's turn on this track. Worked off the pads for one

oho, mix up from the batsmen, mix up from the fielders. Much ado about nothing. Steeres straight to point by Thilan, Angelo was almost all the way down before he realised Thilan wasn't coming. Cheema took a while gettng back to the bowler's end. He collected the throw, but could not break the stumps.
this time Thilan gets the single in front of square. Over to Angelo.

strange scenes. Angelo plays a lap sweep, almost straight to a comical tumbling Balaji at square leg, who doesn't pouch it, but propels the ball a good ten feet in the air as he lands and it pops out. How did he do that?
smarts from Samaraweera. Playing the pace of the ball, backing away and steering with finesse through third man. Shot of a man with a 50+ Test average.
and he gets a single to midwicket to retain strike
Thilan hangs in the crease and works it in front of square for another single
Baidwan lands another bouncer on the spot, that's the third he's bolwed at him, and the second since their altercation. Again, Angelo ducks
good delivery, Angelo backs away, Baidwan sees him go away and delivers the perfect yorker around a foot down the leg side, where Mathews feet are. He can't do anything with it.

Sixty years from now, the grandchildren in the Baidwan household will hear this story. Harvir has won a memorable mini-battle here. Angelo and he have sparred at each other, and he's stuck to his guns despite the heat in the air. This one was the slower ball, delivered back of driving length and sucking Mathews into the drive. He scoops it to the leg side high, and Harvir runs back to complete the catch by himself. And then he roars in joy!
short ball, Thilan waits for it and rolls the wrist to send it behind square for a couple

Thilan's giving a strong case for promotion here! He fashions a late dab out of nowehere as Baidwan lands this in line with off, back of a length. Thilan arches back and opens the face to steer it away very fine for four more
length ball on the pads, he stays on the crease and nudges it through midwicket for one

my my, Thilan is playing some exquisite non-slog overs shots here. Another delicate cut behind point, much squarer than last time, but he's timing them perfectly here. Waited for it to sit up and caressed it on top of the bounce.
smart, yorker, but well outside off and close to the tram-lines. He gets away with it
offcutter breaks back in appreciably, Thilan waits and opens the face to steer another single through the off side
Kula makes room through the off side and carves it out to deep point where a fumble gives him an easy couple

Kula ends with a flourish, bashing a short length ball with cross-batted disdain over mid on. He timed that quite well, as the fielder at long on - running across and putting in a big dive - found out

inn2.comm: Kulasekara gets his trademark seam movement away from the left-handers straightaway, left alone
on middle and off this time, goes straight on and that is defended back to the bowler
superb delivery from Kula, angles away from Gunasekera, who is beaten by that good length delivery, Gunasekera does some gardening after that ball
outside off, left alone by Gunasekara this time
stands tall and punches that with confidence, pushed towards extra cover
short of length delivery on legstump, defended towards square leg, batsmen think of taking a single before deciding against it

Perera starts with a beauty, Davison is gone for a first-baller, a short of length ball that moves in a touch, not sure whether there was an inside-edge on that, Davison looking to push the ball towards mid-off, the ball ends up crashing into the stumps, Perera is a wicket-taker, he was Sri Lanka's leading wicket-taker in one-dayers last year, first ball wicket in the World Cup for him

oh, a sitter is put down at first slip, that was pitched up and a hint of away movement, a healthy outside edge flies at a nice height to Samaraweera, just above the waist, he didn't have to move, that's a clanger and no wonder Perera is glaring at Samaraweera
just down the leg side, off the thigh pad and runs past the keeper for four
solidly defended by Surkari off the front foot
length ball on middle stump, tucked towards square leg for a single
gets on the front foot and defends it to mid-on
length ball to start the over, who gets forward and pushes it to mid-off
an inside-edge this time, that was pitching on middle and leg
carves this one behind point for a single, Kula is keeping it steady here, no width on offer
length ball on off, solid defense off the front foot

Kula gets the second wicket, this might be an early finish at this rate, Gunasekara stay is over, plants his front foot forward and cracks that towards cover, a low catch clasped by the fielder  who barely had to move, Canada have lost their openers
length ball outside off, swings away a touch, left alone by the batsman
accurate from Perera, on middle stump, tucked towards midwicket
short of a length ball homing into middle, dabbed towards midwicket for a single

Sanga shows cat-like reflexes to dive across to his left to collect a low catch, that ball jagged in from short of a length and cuts the batsmen in half, seemed to be a sound as the ball passed the bat, Sri Lanka thought about the review but didn't go for it
138.7kmh, good pace from Perera, well outside off and that's left alone

Perera gets his second, Canada's collapsing here, a length ball that strikes Surkari on the pads in front of middle, that was going on to hit, no doubt about it, the umpire didn't have any, he raises the finger, and Canada are three down
starts with a legspinner outside off
defended from the crease down the pitch
just outside off, blocked towards the off side
backs away to make room, that ball hurried on him and he bottom edges it towards point
an accurate start from Ajantha, defended back to the bowler
ends the over with a delivery that comes in, batsman didn't know much about that, goes for the cut, the ball slides under the bat
Bagai plays the best shot of the innings, a bit of width and that is crashed behind point for four, a confident stroke that
not as confident this time from Bagai, Perera gets the ball to bounce extra from short of a length, that was real quick, Bagai jumps and defends
Bagai goes for a flamboyant cut off the front foot, the ball goes under the bat and the ball swings after passing the bat, sanga has to dive to his left to collect that
solidly defended this time, a good pacy over this from Perera
short of length and outside off, defended towards point
and one more short of length ball outside off, pushed to point
no width on offer, defended to the off side
looks to defend a delivery that slides straight on, pops off the pad to the keeper, who makes a weak appeal
defends off the front foot this time
stays in the crease and blocks to the off side
spearing into legstump, more defence from Canada
length ball outside off, defended again and Mendis starts with two maidens in a row
worked behind point for a single by Bagai
140.6 kmh delivery, outside off and that's left alone
back of a length ball and just outside off, blocked off the back foot
short of length, outside off looks to carve that to cover but can't connect
defends off the front foot, hit high on the bat as he takes a stride forward to block the ball
slanting into legstump, tucked towards midwicket, and this Canadian innings is going nowhere
sliding into legstump, clipped to square leg for a single, first run off Mendis
flighted by Mendis this time, length ball heading for leg, pushed back to the bowler
a quicker one, blocked from the crease
patted back towards the bowler
watchfully played from the crease down the track
clips this one behind square leg for a single
starts with a poor delivery that turns sharply after pitching outside leg, well taken by Sanga
again down the leg side, clips the pad this time
defended towards square leg
pushed back to the bowler
a bit of air from Murali, attacking the legstump, defended once more
gets well back in the crease as he plays that to the off side
not many runs on offer, the final delivery is tapped towards the leg side
on the legstump, tucked to leg slip
gets forward and defends
tucked to deep square leg for a single
thick outside edge towards third man for a couple
length ball, clipped to the leg side for one more
on middle and leg, turned to deep square leg for a single
first ball is played to square leg for a single by Bagai
straighter delivery, defended by Hansra
a full one from Murali, defended by Hansra off the front foot
flicked to deep square leg for a single
another straight one, defended
angling away from Bagai again, Bagai blocks it from the crease
stands tall and blocks the ball to the off side
works this one towards square leg for a single
another single to square leg
pushed towards mid-on by Hansra off the back foot
and again, once more towards mid-off, can't get a run though
Dilshan has raced through that over, perhaps Sri Lanka are worried there might be some rain later on and want to get to the 20-over mark as soon as possible
a doosra to start the over, batsman didn't know much about that, he just about gets his bat out of the way
another doosra outside off, Sanga has some trouble collecting that
flicked off the pads towards backward square leg
gets down on one knee and looks to sweep this one, gets a top edge that loops over leg slip and races away for four to fine leg

Bagai has called for a referral, after deciding to leave a delivery that he thought was a doosra, it isn't a doosra and turns into him after pitching on middle and off, no problem with the line but the height was, it hit him above the pads, and that the first umpire's decision to be overturned in the World Cup, Bagai survives
a wayward ball down the leg side
a length ball on middle, defended to the leg side
length ball turning into the batsman, who opts to play from well inside the crease, pushed towards midwicket
on middle stump this time, punched towards mid-on
loopy delivery that Hansra looks to whip towards midiwcket, Sanga was moving to his left and that clipped the top of the batsman's pad to take the keeper by surprise, he's hit on the arm
clips this one towards square leg, to get a single that brings them level with their previous highest score against Sri Lanka in one-dayers
defends the last ball of the over watchfully
another wide way down the leg side, this is unusual from Murali, so many wides

another referral, this time Sri Lanka is asking for it, Bagai again decides to play that one off the back foot though it isn't a particularly short ball, it pitches just outside off, on-field umpire says the batsman was struck outside off, and that is a very close one, marginally outside off and the height was also a question, Bagai lives on
stays on the back foot and chops the ball towards backward point
big stride forward as he defends to the leg side
fullish ball that is pushed back down the track
this one doesn't turn in from Murali, batsman can't reach that one outside off
on the pads, worked in front of square leg, Sri Lanka have bowled 16 overs in little over 50 minutes, not an over rate that you see often
on the pads and that's defended
outside edge as he looks to block off the front foot, ball races towards short third
punched towards mid-on for a single
length ball pitching outside off, defended off the front foot
similar length but Bagai played off the backfoot, towards backward square leg
steered towards cover to end another quick over
Samaraweera, there's a surprise, his first ball is blocked to the keeper
on the pads, tucked towards short fine leg
guides this ball towards short third man
length ball on off, punched towards long-on for a single

Murali couldn't get a wicket, neither could Mendis or Dilshan, but Samaraweera ,their fourth choice spinner, can, he has Hansra out stumped as the batsman looking to force the ball through covers, he had dragged his back leg out of the crease, couldn't get it back in before Sanga took the bails off, Sanga was very confident that was out even before the third umpire was called for, sanada lose their fourth, it was the arm ball from Samaraweera that brought about the dismissal, he had started out as a specialist  offpsinner remember
length ball is smothered by the forward defensive
Dilshan starts the over with a length ball, pushed towards mid-on
ungainly defensive shot, ball rolls towards the leg side
blocked back to the bowler from the crease
defended to the leg side
punched off the front foot to mid-on for a single that takes Cheema off the mark
defended to the leg side to end the over, Dilshan got through that one in 1 minute and 50 seconds
punched off the back foot towards cover
stays in the crease and pushes it towards extra cover
solidly defended to the off side off the front foot
poked towards point this time, another dot bal
eases this towards mid-on for a single
another over that took less than 2 minutes to complete, defended to end the over, and Sri Lanka will take their time now that the 20 overs are done
big appeal for lbw, a full delivery that strikes the batsman in front of leg, that was sliding down though
Cheema is reputed to be a big-hitter, he shows that by flat-batting a short of length ball through midwicket for four, all power and no finesse on that one
and once more Cheema is struck on the pads, again the ball is slanting down the leg
a full toss from Kula, swings in to the batsman, tucks towards square leg
short of length ball pitching outside off, chopped off the back foot towards point
sharp movement into the right-hand batsman, who shuffles across the stumps and whips the ball towards fine leg
back of a length outside off stump, he hangs back and punches into the covers
similar ball, he's running in with purpose and hitting the deck. Steered to point
Murali has the doosra, but Thisara has the theesra. Fast length ball outside off, Bagai flashes at it without moving the feet. Thin edge, safely through to Sanga.
full and fast on the pads, flicked with a flourish for a couple to deep square leg

Huge appeal for lbw, but I think umpire Tarapore has got it right. Sanga asks for the referral. Back of a length, seemed to land outside leg before hitting the pad. That's my gut feel - now for the replays. There, landed outside leg, and then it doesn't matter where it is going. Sanga loses his second referral.
back of a length again, Tyson stays back and defends down the track
Bang bang from Cheema. Full length ball from Kula on middle and leg, Cheema moved away and converted into a half-volley before launching it over extra cover. Muscle.
Kula is following him here as Cheema backs away, and gets hit on the toes.
this time Kula gets one to nip away from the left-hander, who is clueless as he gropes inside the line
back of a length on the pads, Tyson hangs on the crease and turns it to the leg side.
full delivery, homing in with line with middle and leg, Cheema gets the front foot inside the line and flicks through midwicket
Thisara delivers a monster yorker, and a rampant Cheema can't do much more than dig it out to the leg side
short ball, pacy and hurries into Cheema who under-edges a pull onto his thigh and it nearly sits up for a return catch, but Thisara can't make it in time
length ball coming in with the angle, Cheema backs away and hacks at it through the midwicket area
attempted yorker on the pads, Tyson clips it square for another single
lands this well short of a length, Cheema was setting himself up for a drive, and could not make contact as he tried to adjust and pull
this Cheema can hit 'em all right. Thisara misses the blockhole by inches, it is enough for Cheema to get under the length and muscle powerfully over midwicket.
more movement off the seam as Kula whistles in and angles across Tyson. He lets it go outside the off stump
again, this time Tyson thinks of playing but pulls the bat away as an afterthought

this is dream bowling from Kula. Superb offcutter, landed on the seam and reared up like a monster as it moved away. Tyson was squared up big time there. In fact he became (Tyson)^2. Ended taking the outside edge as he desperately tried to get bat on it. Sanga gobbles it behind the stumps.
hangs in the crease and pokes at a delivery in Courtney Walsh style, as it goes through wide outside off
closer to the off stump this time, Chohan pushes to the off side

this one angles in and Chohan pushes towards mid on and takes off for a single that was never there. Cheema did not even back up, what a legend! Chohan ran one and a half runs and made his ground, just in time.
ooh, what did that hit? Thisara runs through Cheema with a full length ball on middle and leg. They appeal for caught behind, it is turned down. Did it hit pad? Then he was close to being lbw.
short ball, smacks a back of length ball right back past the bowler for one
nice shot from Chohan, commits to the drive early and goes through with the shot though the ball comes on slowly, lofted cleanly over mid off for four more
lovely away swinger from Thisara, came in from wide of the crease, landed and went the other way. Better batsmen might have got bat on it, but Chohan had no chance.
back of a length on off stump, Chohan stays back and defends to the off side
length ball, there for the smash down the ground, and it is hit hard towards long on for a single

Kula delivers a surprisingly pacy bouncer and Chohan is taken aback as he shapes to pull in haste. That either took top edge or shoulder before ballooning up and Sanga pouched it as he tumbled forward. Cleanly taken, so the umpires are checking what that hit. Replays say it went off the glove, so Chohan is on the way back. He's a little confused, he seemed to suggest it hit the shoulder
length ball on off stump, Baidwan plays it off the front foot towards extra cover
bouncer like he means it, Baidwan is pushed back and defends to the off side without much control
this one curves in viciously from outside off and Baidwan manages to get bat on it as he swipes uncertainly through the leg side
bouncer to end the over, Cheema has taken guard well outside leg and just lets this one go
tossed up from round the wicket on leg stump, flicked through midwicket for one

whoa, Cheema has banged the world's best bowler, and the biggest spinner of the cricket ball against the spin over the extra cover boundary for a majestic six. Tossed up, he reaches out and blasts it over the boundary
big turn this time, Cheema pulls out of his intention to go big over the off side and defends
poor stuff from Murali, Cheema scares him into landing it short and wide, Cheema waits and slices it easily through the square boundary for four.
more like it, tossed up and turning in big, Cheema reaches out and defends down the track
an offspinner to start with, worked off the pads to midwicket for a single
again, comes in from a length, hits the pads on the way to Mahela at slip
and a googly this time, Baidwan is barely picking them. Keeps this one out somehow
another one turning in from off stump, Baidwan is more compact, coming forward and smothering
again, Baidwan leans out to the middle and leg line and defends to the leg side
flatter from Murali, from wide of a crease and it turns in from outside off. He keeps it out

Cheema has the upperhand over Murali. He's danced down the track, taken a quick length ball on the bounce and carted it high over long on for a six. High and huge, long on thought he had a chance. Nice try.

Murali nearly has him with a doosra! Cheema comes forward and looks to drive, but it turns away from him, Sanga collects and whips the bails off. It goes to the third umpire, and he rules it not out as Cheema seems to have got a toe back in. What's more, Murali's over-stepped!
fires it in back of a length as Cheema charges out, but he can't get to the pitch of it and hoicks without control to the leg side
sharp turn from round the wicket, worked with the spin to the leg side for one
Kapu has dropped it at midwicket. Tossed up from Murali, Cheema was decieved in the flight and lofted it high towards deep midwicket. Kapu ran in, tumbled forward and put it down.
nicely played, length delivery, breaking away off the track, Baidwan just drove though the line over wide long off. Well controlled
now the googly and he did not seem to pick it as he leant out to play off the front foot
faster and flatter googly this time, Baidwan plays back and plays all around it
flighted again outside off, Baidwan leans out and drives over extra-cover for a couple more
looks to sweep a delivery that's on middle and leg, and a single to backward square leg. Came off the pad.
back of a length and straightening from outside off, he stays back and defends down the track
Baidwan gets a single working with the spin to the leg side

aha, you can hit Murali for a couple of sixes, but you can't get away from him can you? Murali foxes Cheema out with another doosra, Cheema did not pick it as it broke away from the like of off stump. Cheema was playing for off spin and looking to launch it straight, it took the outside edge and ended in short third man's hand
Murali rips this across him and it goes to first slip who has a shy at the stumps as Balaji dawdles out of his crease. Misses the mark though. Might have been out.
very full on middle and leg, sweeps it somehow in the air, safely behind square for a single
Baidwan has probably never played a doosra before today. Looks at it cluelessly as it goes away, past his sweep in hope.
length ball, no turn, Balaji pokes out and defends
tossed up outside off, Balaji is foxed by the flight and swishes at it without getting his foot across. Outside edge runs away to third man for four
back of a length on the pads, Balaji works it in front of square for one
two finger googly, slides down the leg side, hits the pads and goes to fine leg for a couple
stays back and works a ball from outside off towards point
flighted outside off, he leans out and defends cautiously.
tossed up and turning away from outside off, Balaji leaves.

and that's that. Tossed up on middle and leg, Balaji sweeps again without any intention of keeping it down. Catching practice for the man at deep backward square leg. Baidwan hangs around, waiting for Osinde to come out.
flighted outside off, swept along the ground for a single
ah Murali has dropped it. Flighted outside off, Osinde hits it real hard back at the bowler, and he doesn't manage to hold on to it. And no, Osinde did not say "You just dropped the World Cup, mate"
flight again, this time on middle and off, Osinde thumps it hard down to long on for one
Baidwan looks for another controlled sweep to a tossed up ball on off, but can't get the gap
full toss on the pads, flicked square for a single
on the pads again, played from the crease backward of square for a single
googly from Mendis, Osinde doesn't spot it and plays around it
goes for an almighty hoick as Mendis invitingly tosses it up outside off, and he misses.
driven off the backfoot to covers
swept behind square leg for a single
walloped down the ground, lands short of long-on
defended watchfully  by the batsman
gets on the back foot and defends, that nearly sneaked past the bat
the batsman picks up the doosra, and carves it to deep point
straighter one pitching on legstump, fine leg fields
length ball is punched off the back foot towards mid-off
didn't pick the offspinner, that turns big and slides down leg side
a more gentle offpsinner this, hits the pad as the batsman looksto  defend, sliding down leg
edged towards point this time
flighted and full on off stump, swept down to fine leg

and that's the end of that, the crowd roars, at least the portion of the crowd that stayed behind, loads left realising what a one-sided encounter was in store, the batsman looks to swing that to the leg side, it was a googly, clips the off bail, Canada have folded for 122
